resources.string: The classic dirty ill-famed bar you shouldn\'t go to. Long drinks feel like gasoline.
Old fashioned fake-British pub, established in 1972. Kind of expensive, the place to go if you really miss England.
Hipster-favourite, friendly people and great fun. Great bet anytime, particularly good during springtime.
The dear old, great place that everybody in the old town love. Kind of ill-famed but it\'s ok, never saw a fight there.
Traditional Genovese pizza and focaccia, with a great landscape on the bay. Established in 1913.
Premium traditional Genovese food surrounded by countryside and vineyards.
If you live in Genoa, just a couple of minutes away by drive separate you from the best fried food in the region. Friendly staff.
After a day at the beach, why not having some excellent handmade food on the hills?
Great dance club, great parties, gay-friendly, a must-go.
A dance lounge built on top of a floating platform within Genoa harbor, fancy.
To be honest, you will just find boring posh people there but if your purpose is showing off this is the place to go.
Same as above but at least there are a restaurant and a beach.
Università degli Studi di Genova - Engineering
You could not care but you don\'t see an engineering department inside a XVI century italian villa everyday.
Museo di Storia Naturale Giacomo Doria
A nice early XX century building filled with naturalistic knowledge. Kind of dusty.
The place to go if you like astronomy. Lots of popular events, lovely little place run by friendly volunteers.
A diesel-powered submarine turned into a museum. Yes, you can go inside. Yes, it will make your day.
A public library inside XV century villa, inside a big park. What else?
World-famous monumental cemetry, featuring some near-celebrity buried there, like Oscar Wilde\'s wife. The Cure fans will love this.
Only renaissance nobility palaces here. UNESCO protected heritage or something like that.
